title: Introduction to Research
description: Advanced exploration of research covering current research and industry practices.

title: Fundamentals of Theory
description: Interdisciplinary approach to theory combining theoretical knowledge with practical problem-solving.

title: Intermediate Methods
description: Fundamental concepts and applications of methods. Designed for students pursuing careers in related fields.

title: Intermediate Seminar
description: Examination of key concepts and methodologies in seminar. Includes hands-on experience and case studies.

title: Methods
description: Interdisciplinary approach to methods combining theoretical knowledge with practical problem-solving.

title: Advanced Practice
description: Rigorous treatment of practice theory and applications with emphasis on research methodology.

title: Applications
description: Examination of key concepts and methodologies in applications. Includes hands-on experience and case studies.

title: Advanced Practice
description: Interdisciplinary approach to practice combining theoretical knowledge with practical problem-solving.
prerequisites: PHIL 391 and senior standing or graduate status

title: Advanced Practice
description: In-depth analysis of practice principles. Students will develop critical thinking and problem-solving skills.
prerequisites: PHIL 343 and senior standing or graduate status
